body.p:
To his Excellency
Tho. E Bromblett Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Your petitioners would most respectfully State that at the April Term of the Cumberland Circuit Court 1865, four judgments were rendered against them (Separately) copy of each judgement is herewith in closed. As heretofore stated at the time of selling the whiskey for which judgments were rendered there were no trustees or other persons in town authorized to grant them license they in good faith attempted to procure license as they did not desire to violate the law they were also misled by as to the privilege & authority of the Government License which they had & paid for many other persons were selling by retail liquor in Burksvill at same time under Government License & they beleaved that was sufficient for them. They ask that said fines be remitted, and as in duty bound they will ever pray &c

A. N. English John Hill
Charles Hill W O Hill
these cases are similar to those heretofore acted upon by your Excelency & ought to be remitted & I hope will be

Cumberland Cir Ct
vs
John Hill
Wm O. Hill
Chas Hill
A. N. English
$10. each
Remitted 7 Aug/65
